dmca.title: [EV1-C2547318T] Unauthorized Use of DreamWorks SKG Properties
dmca.body:
We are unable to locate on the web page www.maskedwife.com/alexhiro/
any of the material that you claim is being infringed as of 10:14:32
a.m. (GMT-6).

VIA ELECTRONIC MAIL AND U.S. MAIL 
 
  
 
ThePlanet.com Internet Services, Inc.  
1333 North Stemmons Freeway
Suite 110
Dallas, TX 75207 
 
  
 
abuse@theplanet.com 
 
  
 
  
 
  
 
Re:       Unauthorized Use of DreamWorks SKG Properties 
 
                        http://www.maskedwife.com/alexhiro/ 
 
  
 
  
 
To Whom It May Concern:: 
 
  
 
This letter is being written to you on behalf of DreamWorks SKG
(hereinafter "DreamWorks").  DreamWorks is the owner of rights in and to
the "Shrek" and "The Road to El Dorado" motion pictures (hereinafter The
DreamWorks Copyrights and Trademarks). No one is authorized to copy,
reproduce, distribute, or otherwise use The DreamWorks Copyrights and
Trademarks without the express written permission of DreamWorks. 
 
  
 
It has come to our attention that the web site located at " 
http://www.maskedwife.com/alexhiro/" for which you are the service
provider, contains unauthorized copies and derivative copies of The
DreamWorks Copyrights and Trademarks, including but not limited to,
sexually explicit depictions of "The Shrek" and "The Road to El Dorado" 
motion picture characters. Attached hereto are photocopies of
representative pages from the aforementioned web site. 
 
  
 
DreamWorks has the good faith belief that the use of the material in the
manner complained of is not authorized by DreamWorks, its agent or the
law. DreamWorks diligently enforces its rights in the "The Shrek" and
"The Road to El Dorado" motion pictures in all forms of media. Our
client rightfully takes its responsibility for the protection of the
"The Shrek" and "The Road to El Dorado" motion pictures very seriously. 
 
  
 
As you may be aware, Internet Service Providers can be held liable if
they do not respond to claims of infringement pursuant to the
requirements of the Digital Millennium Copyright Act (DMCA).  In
accordance with the DMCA, we request your assistance in the removal of
infringements of The DreamWorks Copyrights and Trademarks from this web
site and any other sites for which you act as an Internet Service
Provider. We further declare under penalty of perjury that we are
authorized to act on behalf of DreamWorks and that the information in
this letter is accurate. Please contact me immediately to discuss this
matter further. 
 
  
 
  
 
This letter is not a complete statement of DreamWorks' rights in
connection with this matter, and nothing contained herein constitutes an
express or implied waiver of any rights, remedies, or defenses of
DreamWorks in connection with this matter, all of which are expressly
reserved. 
 
  
 
  
 
Very truly yours, 
 
  
 
/s/ 
 
  
 
Dennis L. Wilson 
 
Keats McFarland & Wilson LLP 
 
  
 
  
 
cc:  DreamWorks SKG
